title: Had Slavic tribes been Turkified before they emigrated from Central Asia to Europe? - Quora

response.answer_text: If anything these were remains of Indo-Iranians migrating from their urheimat, somewhere between South-Eastern Poland and Fatyanovo Culture Horizon in Russia, who might have become Turkified, as their marker male haplogroup, R1a-Z93 is one of the most prolific among Turkics (and Indians, Iranians and Jewish). Slavs remained where they always were. We might have assimilated Germanic and Celtic tribes living among our ancestors, yet that's it.

The Slavic tribes never emigrated from anywhere as they are one of the most ancient indigenous people of Europe. In fact the Slavic languages belong to the most ancient group of Languages in Europe and the Slavic tribes were always the largest groups of people and there is no change now as they STILL are the largest group of people in Europe, more precisely there are over 350 million of them here in Europe. A lot of people in the world in fact have Slavic roots as well.
